--- Page 1 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
In accordance with IMTAR – 21, Subpart C1, 21.C1.18, Subpart C2, 21.C2.9 & Subpart C3, 21.C3.1.20.
Part - I (Reference): Incident /Accident/ Snag / Explosive
a) Defect Report (DR) No: DR/2021/0570 b) Date of Occurrence: 03/02/2023
c) Installation Details: Medusa Strike - AC-7636-814 at
Sector East Station
Part - II: (Details of Defective Component)
a) Trade: Armament b) Date Component 09/02/2023
Received:
c) System/Sub System: Fire Control d) Main Assembly: Fuselage Center
e) Nomenclature: Fire Control Assembly Unit f) MOD Status: Modified
g) Part No.: AR-1364-U9 h) Sl No.: SN-4811-780
i) Firmware Version: Not Applicable j) Software Version: Not Applicable
k) Date of Installation: 04/12/2022 l) Date of Removal: 06/02/2023
Pg No: 19 Ln No: 11 Pg No: 105 Ln No: 28
m) Manufacturing Agency: Pinnacle Aerospace n) Date, Month & Year June 2018
of Manufacturing:
o) Whether under warranty: No p) Whether under AMC Yes
/ Repair Contract:
q) Life completed since New: 2452 Hrs / 1960 Cycles

--- Page 2 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part - III: (Defect Details)
a) Defect Category: Observation
b) Defect Observed: Ammunition feed jam. Defect found during scheduled maintenance.
Part IV: Investigation: (Details of Examination including previous similar Defects)
a) Root Cause Analysis: Software algorithm error in control logic implementation
b) Findings / Conclusions: Detailed investigation conducted on the defective Fire Control component. Functional
testing confirmed the reported anomaly.
c) Remedial Measures Repair damaged area using approved repair scheme
i. Corrective Action:
ii. Preventive Action: Introduce protective coating to prevent environmental degradation
d) Attributable Code: NFF - No Failure Found
Remarks: Comprehensive analysis performed. Root cause identified and verified.
Part V: Remarks by Design
Design review completed. No design modification required. Component replacement as per maintenance manual is adequate.
Date: 17/02/2023 Authorized Signatory of Design: Eng. T.R. Menon

--- Page 3 (pdf_text) ---
Centre for Military Airworthiness and Certification
FORM - 44
DEFECT INVESTIGATION REPORT FORMAT
Part VI: Remarks by Quality Dept.
Quality aspects reviewed. Manufacturing process controls are adequate. Recommend supplier quality audit.
Date: 20/02/2023 Signature: Sqn Ldr H.S. Bhatia
Part VII: Remarks by User(Project):(if applicable)
User feedback incorporated. Recommend enhanced crew training on system operation and limitations.
Date: 20/02/2023 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Part VIII: Remarks by ORDAQA (Quality Aspects)
Quality oversight review completed. Recommend monitoring effectiveness of implemented preventive actions.
Date: 24/02/2023 Signature: Eng. K.N. Iyer
Part IX: Remarks by CEMILAC / RCMA (Design Aspects)
Airworthiness implications assessed. Recommend issuance of technical directive for fleet-wide compliance.
Date: 22/02/2023 Signature: Dr. S.M. Kulkarni
Edition Number: 1.0 Form Version Number: 1.0 Date: January 2021
